revised_title: Reevaluating the Alleged Increase of Cancer
tldr: This article discusses the alleged increase in cancer mortality rates and examines the factors that may have contributed to the rise. The authors argue that improved diagnosis and more accurate reporting of cause of death may have played a significant role in the increase. They also highlight the importance of considering age distribution in interpreting cancer mortality rates and suggest using a standard age distribution for comparison.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Epidemiology
